member.summary: Calculates hash for a string with a prefixed salt value. A "salt" is random data prefixed to every hashed value to prevent common dictionary attacks.

member.name: M:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Hash.CalculatePrivate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates hash for an array of bytes

member.name: T:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Hash
member.summary: Hash functions are fundamental to modern cryptography. These functions map binary strings of an arbitrary length to small binary strings of a fixed length, known as hash values. A cryptographic hash function has the property that it is computationally infeasible to find two distinct inputs that hash to the same value. Hash functions are commonly used with digital signatures and for data integrity.

member.name: F:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.DES
member.summary: The Data Encryption Standard provider supports a 64 bit key only

member.name: F:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.RC2
member.summary: The Rivest Cipher 2 provider supports keys ranging from 40 to 128 bits, default is 128 bits

member.name: F:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.Rijndael
member.summary: The Rijndael (also known as AES) provider supports keys of 128, 192, or 256 bits with a default of 256 bits

member.name: F:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Symmetric.Provider.TripleDES
member.summary: The TripleDES provider (also known as 3DES) supports keys of 128 or 192 bits with a default of 192 bits

member.summary: Using the default Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode, all data blocks are processed using the value derived from the previous block; the first data block has no previous data block to use, so it needs an InitializationVector to feed the first block

member.name: T:SMT.Alentejo.Core.Encryption.Asymmetric
member.summary: Asymmetric encryption uses a pair of keys to encrypt and decrypt. There is a "public" key which is used to encrypt. Decrypting, on the other hand, requires both the "public" key and an additional "private" key. The advantage is that people can send you encrypted messages without being able to decrypt them.
member.remarks: The only provider supported is the
